instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U5701: What is U5701? this is the keyboard controller chip that takes the keyboard and trackpad input and turns it into a USB device signal for the machine to process. If replacing a keyboard doesnâ€™t fix an issue with keys not typing, check all traces between keyboard connector and this IC. This chip has programming so it must be replaced from a similar, ideally identical board. .

threads.title: Alt pressed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Very stranged case. This macbook pro comes to me because sometimes when power on the macbook it goes to boot menu and in OS X appears simbols that normaly appears when press ALT+some key.
Keyboard was durty and I thought it is keyboard issue and I repalced the keyboard. Tested and work ok, but next day customers come again and I can see now that problems appear again. If it is not keyboard problem, what more could be?

threads.title: Alt pressed <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Corrosion in keyboard connector or <CHIP>U5750</CHIP>/55 or <CHIP>U5701</CHIP>.
